name: Ottoman Hotel Imperial

reviews.text: The best feature of this hotel was the location, directly across from the Aya Sofya on a small cobblestone street. We had a view of Aya Sofya from our room that was only partly obacured by big leafy trees. That was lovely.
reviews.title: Terrific location, smallish rooms, food could be better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice. Decor is traditional with some Turkish touches; there are traditional costumes hanging in the halls and interesting lamps in the rooms. There's some lokum/Turkish delight in the room in a pretty pewter (?) container when you arrive. The room is not big, which could be a problem is you have a lot of luggage but it was sufficient.
reviews.title: What you see is what you get. Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is room for improvement in the breakfast. Variety was fine but the food could be more fresh. Some of the bread and pastry were a bit stale. Also please do something about those scrambled eggs! Another reviewer noted that they are sitting in a puddle of water. It's totally true. Please fix that or just make eggs to order!
reviews.title: Istanbul Gem.

reviews.text: We recently stayed here for 4 days in July based on other travelers reviews. The location was ideal and we had a lovely room , bright, airy, spacious and of course very clean ( gets cleaned everyday ) and the bathroom was huge and modern. the breakfast was great and the staff was friendly and helpful. Well worth the price!
reviews.title: The best location for exploring Sultanahmet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was fantastic. Our stay was for only for a short time, but even then we were delighted with the hotel itself and was in a great location allowing easy access to the city centre and to the hostorical sights.
reviews.title: Extraordinary Hotel.

reviews.text: The hotel's location can't be beaten. Located in a quiet street besides Hagia Sophia but away from the maddening crowds of the Sultanahmet area. 5 minutes walk to both Sultanahmet and Gulhane tram station.
reviews.title: Right besides Hagia Sophia!!!

reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel at 7.30am and was allowed to check in immediately and as I was to leave the hotel in the wee hours the next day, the front office offered me breakfast on the morning I checked in. I had a single room which was small but adequate and quiet with everything in working order.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Location

reviews.text: I suggest a hotel pick-up to/from the airport to save the pain of dealing with taxi drivers which is giving the city a bad name. I was stupid enough to fall for the "50 lira changes to 5 lira" scam.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel in amazing location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from this, Istanbul is a magical city although this is my second time here and would definitely return again and stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here prior to joining a cruise to the Black Sea. It was recommended by a travel agent and we found it excellent. Charming reception and welcome overall. The rooms are not large but this is in an ancient part of the city - the bathroom was stunning!
reviews.title: Good hotel to start off our two week European journey.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 302 and everything was great especially the haman bathroom.
reviews.title: Premium location, quality hotel.

reviews.text: The transfers booked through the hotel worked well both ways
reviews.title: One very satisfied guest.

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel as it's location is outstanding
reviews.title: Absolutely Fab

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is truly located on the premium location, every major attractions are all around you and it's within five minutes of the hotel. We splurge and reserved one of the premium Sultans rooms and it was very comfortable, bright, spacious, all amenities that we would need for our stay were available, had a good surprise in the bathroom were it was designed in a Turkish hammam style, very interesting. As I stated earlier, all your top attractions as Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Underground Cistern are few minutes away. There is a nice park not far from the hotel, if you walk through to the other side of the park you'll come across to Bosphoruse. Good stay, do recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Could not have asked for a better location.

reviews.text: On arrival at hotel we were welcomed with welcome drinks and given key & card to room.
reviews.title: Not what I expected

reviews.text: We were taken up to our room (308) on the second floor through the restaurant and the small lift, which goes to show the hotel is really small.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience.
Location can't be beat
reviews.text: The room itself was clean and plenty of towels and clean sheets were provided. Our beds were single as we had a twin room and I have to say they were not single beds but were sized like children’s beds. I am not that tall and my feet stuck out of the bed. There were two pillows provided, a large and a larger one but both had so much fluff and air that it was uncomfortable to sleep on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was so bad that I just had tea and toast every morning after trying the ridiculously low quality food. The scrambled eggs had water puddles in them, disgusting. For the small amount of guests they have you would expect fresh orange juice not concentrate. I have had better breakfast in a B&B hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful location, good base to explore Istanbul.

reviews.text: The bathroom/toilet was so small that you had to move sideways in and out. When I was sat on the toilet my knees were right against the wall. As for the shower the whole 3 days I was there the water would not drain properly and I was standing foot deep in dirty water.
reviews.title: Great Location near major historical attractions

description: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is situated on the truly premium location in Istanbul, on an elevated position, surrounded by all the major historical and cultural sights in the heart of the old town, Sultanahmet, viewing the impressive Hagia Sophia (St.Sophia, Aya Sofya) Museum. This is absolutely the best location in Istanbul, within easy walking distance of the main monuments.
